Sentence: The patient was referred to the specialist because he had a rare skin condition.
Options:
(A) The patient had a skin condition
(B) The specialist had a skin condition
(C) Ambiguous
model_outputs.model_answer:
Sentence: The patient was referred to the specialist because he had a rare skin condition.

Option (A): The antecedent of the pronoun "he" in the sentence is the patient. It refers to the patient who had a rare skin condition and was referred to the specialist.

Option (B): The antecedent of the pronoun "he" in this sentence is ambiguous and could refer either to the patient or the specialist, depending on the context in which the sentence is used. However, in this particular sentence, the context suggests that the pronoun refers to the patient.

Option (C): This option is also ambiguous and could refer either to the patient or the specialist. Because of this ambiguity, it is best to avoid using pronouns such as "he" or "she" when referring to individuals without specifically identifying them.
